I had trouble understanding this concept during Chem 112 in college, but you, ma'am made this concept so easy to understand! Now I am prepping for med school by reviewing old materials and this MIT courses are so helpful!
The equilibrium constant we calculated using delta G nought, isn't it supposed to be the value for k=[H+][OH-]/[H2O]? and since K=Kw/[H2O] ,therefor Kw=K*[H2O]
looking for the second portion of this lecture

The reason aspirin and other NSAIDs cause stomach problems isn't their pH.  Normal stomach pH varies, but can go as low as 1.5.  The problem with NSAIDs is that the same mechanisms are used in undesirable inflammation and in the normal healing processes involved in maintaining an intact stomach lining, so when a drug suppresses one it tends to suppress the other too.
Nice lecture on acid-base equilibrium. Really good brush up for a test or review.
